While I don't have personal reading experiences, I can suggest a novel that fits your description. "The Warehouse" by Rob Hart features a character named Zinnia "Jamie" Jones who works within a massive, privately-owned storage and retail facility known as The Warehouse. Although not purely dystopian, it does touch upon the manipulative aspects of modern technology and the impact of algorithms on social interactions.

Another novel that might interest you is "Permanent Record" by Edward Snowden, a memoir which delves into the role of big tech companies in collecting and using personal data, although it doesn't specifically have a protagonist named Jamie.

Lastly, "The Circle" by Dave Eggers is a popular dystopian novel set in a powerful tech company where the protagonist, Mae Holland, works.
